catalog_info.title: Grounding the Global: Anthropological Approaches
catalog_info.description: What is the value of anthropology for understanding today’s world? This course illustrates the importance of an anthropological perspective for engaging with a wide range of pressing global issues such as bilingualism, water and the environment, visual media, and health epidemics. Over the semester, students will grapple with what it means to "ground the global" through an emphasis on everyday experience, cultural particularity, subject formation, and collective action.
